Neither the GOP's plan nor the ACA addresses the real crisis in health care - COST! Health care inflation has been out-of-control for decades. There is only one solution - single payer, government run health care - ya, know, like the rest of the First World enjoys. The current system is hopelessly inefficient and utterly lacks controls on costs. Which is we pay far more for drugs and health services than the rest of the world. 

For those who rail against government run health care - newsflash - the Federal Government has long been, by far, the biggest consumer of health care. If you include the tax exemption for employer run plans the Fed was effectively already paying 90% of health dollars before the ACA. Get the insurance companies and the 40 to 50% of every health dollar they skim out of health care. 

And care is already "rationed" - by the ability to pay.
